extracted_information: The provided WEB CONTENT is an 'Aztec Overview' page, outlining fundamental technical concepts. It serves as an introduction and points to other resources for detailed implementation guides, code examples, and specific API structures.

specifications.aztec_js_description: Aztec.js is a TypeScript library, similar to web3js or ethersjs, through which users interact with Aztec. It includes the Private Execution Environment (PXE) and can run within Node or the browser.
specifications.pxe_details: The Private Execution Environment (PXE, 'pixie') is a client-side library for execution and proof-generation of private operations. It holds keys, notes, and generates proofs. It is unaware of the Public VM.
specifications.noir_description: Noir is a zero-knowledge domain-specific language (DSL) used for writing smart contracts for the Aztec network and creating circuits verifiable on or off-chain.

features.name: Aztec.js Functionality
features.description: Enables user interaction with the Aztec network. Orchestrates client-side execution of private functions via the PXE.

features.name: Private Execution (PXE)
features.description: Client-side execution of private functions on user devices to maintain maximum privacy. Generates proofs for on-chain verification. Private transactions in the PXE are executed first.

features.name: Noir for Smart Contracts
features.description: Language for writing zero-knowledge smart contracts on Aztec. Supports manipulation of private state by creating commitments and nullifiers for UTXO-like 'notes'.

features.name: Account Abstraction
features.description: Every account in Aztec is a smart contract, allowing custom authorization schemes, nonce management, and fee payments. Accounts are backed by nullifier, incoming viewing, and outgoing viewing key pairs.

features.name: Hybrid State Model
features.description: Aztec uses a hybrid public/private state model. Private state works with UTXOs (notes) and nullifiers. Public state behaves like a public ledger, similar to other chains.

references.name: Noir documentation: Writing performant private functions
